ygData.subject: Hey Kaz ...
ygData.msgSnippet: Kaz, My replay sounds harsh now that I ve sent it.  Didn t mean for it to look that way.  But do consider that this list is made up of people who have enjoyed
ygData.messageBody:
Kaz,
My replay sounds harsh now that I've sent it. Didn't mean for it to look that way. But do consider that this list is made up of people who have enjoyed playing bards.
If it takes the combined efforts of this list to convince you that this is a good class to play, your gaming efforts are probably better spent on another class. EQ is meant to be fun and this list is about playing your bard effectively. So if you want to know how to use those songs ... let me assure you that you've come to the right list.
Tyunes
Bill Costlow <atlatyl@...> wrote:
Kaz,
Your compliant is noted. On that note (heheh) here's a thought for you:
Playing a bard isn't for everyone. You might be happier playing a different class.
KAZ <kazvorpal@...> wrote:
My complaint is that the boring span is longer than any other caster at that
level range. Intcasters get three sets of useful spells during that boring
span, wiscasters two, and even with hybrids they get spells at nine, then
fifteen, then twenty two, never having to go eight levels without anything useful.

=====
There are things in the Constitution that have been overtaken by events, by time...Inappropriate, anachronistic, it isn't done anymore...
-- Chairman Henry Hyde, who doesn't believe the Constitution needs to be followed or legally changed, just ignored.
